agency_desc: Not a true "agency," but rather a collection of organizations accepting monetary and/or material donations for individuals impacted by international crises.
service_description: Cares for people affected by conflict, disease outbreaks, natural and human-made disasters, and exclusion from health care in more than 70 countries.
site_details: Visit https://bit.ly/3hePxig online -OR- Call the Donation Line to make a monetary donation by credit or debit card. -- For other donation related inquiries, call or email Donor Services.
site_schedule: Online Donation Portal: Daily 24 hours -- Donation Line: Daily 8am-9pm

agency_desc: Not a true "agency," but rather a collection of organizations accepting monetary and/or material donations for individuals impacted by international crises.
service_description: Works in over 190 countries and territories, helping to save and meaningfully improve the lives of children globally — focusing on the most vulnerable.
site_details: Visit https://bit.ly/3hfJNEY online to make a monetary donation by credit card, debit card, PayPal, Google Pay, or electronic bank transfer.

agency_desc: Not a true "agency," but rather a collection of organizations accepting monetary and/or material donations for individuals impacted by international crises.
service_description: Accepts monetary donations help to restore health, safety, education, economic well-being and power to people devastated by conflict and disaster.
site_details: Visit https://bit.ly/3JY1rti -OR- call the donation line to make a monetary donation by credit card, debit card, PayPal, or electronic bank transfer. -- To make a donation by mail, send check to International Rescue Committee, PO Box 6068, Albert Lea, MN 56007-9847.
site_schedule: Online Donation Portal: Daily 24 hours -- Donation Line: Mon-Fri 9am-6pm

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing information on the prevention and management of primary and secondary lymphedema.
service_description: Provides information and referral as well as education and outreach services related to primary and secondary lymphedema. Maintains lists of treatment providers, support groups, and other resources for lymphedema patients and their families, health care professionals, and the general public.
site_details: Call for information and referrals. -- Many services are available online (including treatment and support group searches).

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing information on the prevention and management of primary and secondary lymphedema.

agency_desc: A commercial pharmaceutical company offering a comprehensive drug expense assistance program for eligible patients.
service_description: Provides assistance with Pfizer prescription medications for eligible patients. Assistance may include insurance support, co-pay help, and Pfizer medications at a free or reduced price.
site_details: Call to speak with a Medicine Access Counselor or visit the website for information or to download an application form.
site_eligibility: Currently prescribed or taking a medication manufactured by Pfizer -- With household income at or below 400% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services to individuals, families, caregivers and the bereaved to help them cope with and manage the emotional and practical challenges of cancer.
service_description: Provides support services to individuals, families, caregivers, and the bereaved to help them cope with and manage the emotional and practical challenges of cancer. Services include counseling, support groups, educational publications, workshops, and financial assistance with expenses such as transportation to appointments, home care, child care, and pain medication. All services are provided free of charge by professional oncology social workers.
site_eligibility: Cancer patients and survivors of all ages and diagnoses -- Caregivers, families and loved ones of those living with cancer (including children and adolescents), the bereaved -- Additional eligibility guidelines exist for direct financial assistance; see website for current restrictions

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides support services to individuals, families, caregivers and the bereaved to help them cope with and manage the emotional and practical challenges of cancer.
service_description: Provides financial assistance to eligible cancer patients who cannot afford the cost of co-pays on prescribed chemotherapy or targeted cancer treatment drugs.
site_details: Call to determine eligibility and start the application process. Have the following information available when calling: Patient information (name, date of birth, phone number, mailing address, Social Security number) -- Insurance information (such as insurance card and details on medical and prescription drug coverage) -- Income information (annual household income and number of dependents) -- Doctor's information (name, address, telephone number) -- Medical information (month/date of diagnosis, cancer type, stage of cancer, current or planned treatment plan) -- The medication(s) or product(s) prescribed
site_eligibility: Must meet household income requirements based on Federal Poverty Guidelines (varies depending on fund) -- Diagnosed with a type of cancer covered by this agency (Note: Call or visit website for a list of diagnoses currently covered.) -- Receiving treatment in the United States -- U.S. citizen or legal resident -- Undergoing chemotherapy or have a chemotherapy or targeted treatment plan in place at the time of application -- Has insurance coverage (private or federal) -- For additional eligibility restrictions call or visit website.
